Authors: Yesmaya V., Ronald A., Hidajat M.
Title: Property exhibition decision support system based on web application
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ronald, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Complexity in finding property on property exhibition which consider many related constraints is quite high. Customers need to spend much time to analyse the right property to buy depends on their constraints whether salary, distance to work, facility, etc. According to the problem, this research will collect the information from customer on property exhibition to find out the constraint. Also, this research will focus on design and analyses the decision support system for property exhibition. Software development life cycle that will be used is scrum which is divided into several processes like backlog, sprints, scrum meetings, and demos. The result of this research is a web application that help customer to collect the information of the property according to their constraints. © 2018 Universitas Ahmad Dahlan.
Author Keywords: Decision support system; Property exhibition; Scrum
References: Ningrong, L., Seung, K.M., A Decision Support System for market-driven product positioning and design (2015) Decision Support Systems, 69, pp. 82-91; George, S., Dimitrios, K., Athanasios, V., Marketing decision support using Artificial Intelligence and Knowledge Modeling: application to tourist destination management (2014) International Confenrence on Strategic Innovative Marketing, 175, pp. 106-113; Sauter, V.L., Decision Support Systems for Business Intelligence (2011) New Jersey. John Wiley & Sons, Inc; Dalbouh, A., Mohammad, H., A questionnaire approach based on the technology acceptance model for mobile tracking on patient progress applications (2013) Journal of Computer Science, 9 (6), pp. 763-770; Phellas, C.N., Bloch, A., Seale, C., Structured methods: interviews, questionnaires and observation (2011) Researching society and culture, 3, pp. 182-183; Power Daniel, J., Burstein, F., Sharda, R., (2011) Reflections on the past and future of decision support systems: Perspective of eleven pioneers. Decision support, pp. 25-48. , Springer, New York, NY; Amin, H.U., Khan, A.R., Acquiring knowledge for evaluation of teachers performance in higher education using a questionnaire (2009) International Journal of Computer Science and Information Security, 2 (1), pp. 180-187

Authors: Ronald A., Yesmaya V., Danaparamita M.
Title: Personal security tracking based on android and web application
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ronald, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Danaparamita, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Nowadays, the frequency of abduction is increasing significantly. Information technology provide many social media which is causing the leaked of personal information where abductor can find out the information. Using social media, people can share location, life event, and anything related about their life event, these become the useful information for the abductor. To anticipate this, a lot of personal tracking device is developed, but the response is too late. Because, the family or relative of the victims will notice that abduction had happen after the victim is lost. According to the problem, this research will focus on develop the personal tracking device which trigger by the victims who own the phone based on android and web application. Whenever the abduction happens, the victim just need to click the button and the system will send a message to the relatives and family in their contact also trigger the notification to the local security. Software development life cycle that will be used is scrum which is divided into several processes like backlog, sprints, scrum meetings, and demos. The result of this research is android application for user and web application for managing application. © 2018 Universitas Ahmad Dahlan.
Author Keywords: Android application; Decision support system; Tracking application; Web application
References: Kinage, R., Kumari, J., Zalke, P., Kulkarni, M., Mobile Tracking Application (2013) International Journal of Innovative Research in Science, Engineering and Technology, 2 (3), pp. 617-623; Shirin, S., Dipina, D.B., Surekha, M.V., Mobile Tracker (2016) International Journal on Cybernetics and Informatics, 5 (2), pp. 213-219; Abhijeet, T., Ahemad, T., Ravindra, S., Pranay, D., Sumit, H., Mobile Tracking Application for Locating Friends using LBS (2013) International Journal of Innovative Research in Computer and Communication Engineering, 1 (2), pp. 303-308; Abha, D., Hardik, S., Krishna, S., Global Positioning System for Object Tracking (2015) International of Computer Application, 109 (8), pp. 40-45; Pressman, R.S., Maxim, B.R., (2010) Software Engineering: A Practitioner's Approach, , Eighth Edition. Jakarta. McGraw-Hill Education; Bird, D.K., The use of questionnaires for acquiring information on public perception of natural hazards and risk mitigation-a review of current knowledge and practice (2009) Natural Hazards and Earth System Sciences, 9, pp. 1307-1325; Singal, P., Chhillar, R.S., A Review on GPS and its Applications in Computer Science (2014) International Journal of Computer Science and Mobile Computing, 3 (5), pp. 1295-1302; Verma, P., Bhatia, J.S., Design and development of GPS-GSM based tracking system with Google Map based monitoring (2013) International Journal of Computer Science, Engineering and Application, 3 (3), pp. 33-40
